alert.note: Alert for McHenry (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 9:27PM CDT until further notice by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the Souris River near Bantry affecting McHenry County... ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Souris River near Bantry. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 1439.7 feet, Flood waters affect farmland or wooded areas in refuge. Due to relative flatness of the area within reach of the gage a rather large area becomes flooded. Damage is to crops and farm buildings. At 1440.2 feet, Water begins crossing the road several hundred feet to the left of the bridge. No towns or major roads are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 1440.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 1441.5 feet Sunday morning, then remain at that level through the first part of the week. - Flood stage is 1440.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 1441.6 feet on 04/09/2017. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
